layout_data.name: Past, Present, Future
layout_data.description: This is a three card reading covering the past, present, and future.

layout_data.name: The Cross
layout_data.description: This spread is good for advice. It is a simple but versatile spread which can also be used to determine the meaning of a confusing card from a previous reading, or to clear up other points of confusion.

layout_data.name: Celtic Cross
layout_data.description: An ancient Celtic method of reading involving 10 cards. This spread is one of the most commonly called upon by readers of all levels. A very practical spread for questions of all types.

grid_items.name: The Crown
grid_items.description: The Crown - Stands for what the asker is aware of consciously.

grid_items.name: The Outcome
grid_items.description: The Outcome - Interpret this card in the context of the entire reading and as an indicator of the path you are currently on, but not necessarily bound to.

grid_items.name: The Recent Past
grid_items.description: The Recent Past - Represents past events and concerns.

grid_items.name: The Significator
grid_items.description: The Significator - Represents what the main theme of the reading deals with, the initial situation.

grid_items.name: The Future
grid_items.description: The Future - Depicts that which lies ahead.

grid_items.name: Hopes and Fears
grid_items.description: Hopes and Fears - Shows the expectations you have concerning the outcome of your question.

grid_items.name: The Crossing Card
grid_items.description: The Crossing Card - Denotes an added impulse that compounds the initial card, whether complimentary or contradictory.

grid_items.name: External Forces
grid_items.description: External Forces - Represents the influence of others in your life as well as trends in your relationships with others.

grid_items.name: Foundation Card
grid_items.description: Foundation Card - Reveals unconscious driving forces that the querent may not be aware of.

grid_items.name: The Querent
grid_items.description: The Querent - Represents the asker and their attitude towards the subject of the reading.
